comments.commentBody: The cauliflower was great but I would try the recipe with drained tomatoes (and maybe a different cheese) next time. My gratin ended up a bit watery.

After Gabby Gifford got shot, some guy at the scene that was interviewed said he had a gun and thought about using it because thought he has a good view of the the shooter.  Luckily he didn't because he would have hit the wrong target.
The comment was on Monday's puzzle, but I posted it earlier today, following up on the FALA la la la.
Agreed. And I am alos appalled by the way all the other officers do nothing to help the dying after they are shot by an officer.

One of the main problems with the police is their credibility. Even when they are caught on tape, like the CPD shot the teenager SIXTEEN times, they are blatently caught lying over and over and over again. They turn off the police cameras when it's convenient or they edit or erase the tapes, like they did with the Burger King video. One gets the impression that they are the criminals, always hiding evidence and lying about it. They seem to ALWAYS be involved in cover-ups!
They were shot while committing a crime

.
And if the Avatar is who I think he is, his granddaughter owned a baseball team that played in 2 World Series, and 3 horses that each won 2 Triple Crown races.

Plus, the guy I'm thinking of would Remember a US ship whose sinking helped to get the nation into a war. This guy was with Lincoln at Gettysburg.

The US Government spends 25% of GDP
The Franch Government Spends 56% of GDP
French unemployment is easily double US unemployment.
With that big beautiful socialist government in France why aren't the unemployment figures the other way around?
I still have the drive-yourself tour of Gettysburg battlefields CD.  Highly recommended way to spend a few hours.
He was the narrator
The narrator.
he was the narrator
Martin Freeman was the narrator of the book.
Re: Quinn - don't forget, he was also knifed (upper arm)!
Lots of sites do plot rehash recaps. I prefer the nytimes recap style.
Last Tango makes my world better!
That's what I tell myself sometimes.

Christian terrorists murdering Americans at the same pace as Saudi inspired terrorists?  Seriously? What is your source; what is your context? Even if you lump the uni bomber and every killer's death count since, you wouldn't even approach the deaths resulting from  the bizarre Saudi Sunni branch of islam.
Does it ever occur to commenters that when they start their thought with the GOP is the cause of all these problems that they lose all credibility with whatever follows?

I, personally  am not religious,  but understand some people's need to worship.   That being said,  I could care less if you worship Christ, Muhammad,  or the flying spaghetti monster.  As long as you are  not  violent,  we're cool. You  get  violent,  well,  we have  a problem.

.
I'm troubled that you neglected to use ELF.

Also, I anticipated reminiscences of LAB FEEs.

Don't even *say* 'breakneck'.

[pfui, pfui, pfui]

A round-about memory: the pfui-pfui-pfui for your kenahora put me into a web search for Jewish superstitions. There I found the other tradition of not tempting the angel of death by naming a child after his father. And that reminded me of a student whose middle name was "Alter."

I asked him if the name was in the family and he said, yes, he got it from his grandfather's first name. "First name? 'Old Man' is a funny name for a child." "Well, he was going to be Shmuel, but he was born very sick. The doctors gave up on him, but the Rabbi said, 'The Angel of Death will come by looking for a baby named Shmuel. You will call him Alter and treat him as an old man, and the Angel of Death will not find him.' And he lived to ripe old age."

and Elke
Went at BREAKneck speed until I hit the SE. I do remember writing letters
( on REAMS of paper with a PEN(N) , which I always Sealed With A Kiss . So the goldstar ELUDED me. Am SO SAD.
On the other hand , since it's not Yom Kippur, had this a.m. for BREAKFAST leftover A LA (A)T(M) (OSA)KA... It PALED compared to last night's fresh ones.

John-thanks for those most eloquent 272 words .

The French Election results, whether the National Front amplifies its result or not could be the direction our own elections may be driven - by fear, in particular by that group of carnival clowns called the GOP1.

Fear became their principal weapon in 1972 in the wake of 9/11. They rolled out the Grand NeoCon war in Iraq as their plan to remake the Middle East. They succeeded in creating instead at destabilizing the Middle East and created ISIS. It was all "mission Accomplished."

They have never ended their campaign of fear and obstruction and it is obvious the Republicans consider the San Bernadino massacre as a great opportunity to escalate their war to terrorize the United States.

This the party that has escalated the rhetoric on non-issues, like their cry that the country is undergoing a massive invasion of Mexicans crossing the Southern border. The reality doesn't matter, I.e. that there is actually an outmigration by Mexican nations and a net zero in border crossings.

The ECB realized too late what a mistake thed'd made in their handling of post crisis. The lower southern countries, Greece, Spain and Portugal, caught a double whammy on their economies. Austerity dug a far deeper hole for them to climb out of.

If the Republicans are successful in terrorizing the country, they will use their power to destroy the economy with "sound economics" as imagined. Y that nut Paul Ryan.

Agree, it only takes one person to challenge and win. Your constitutional rights are not subject to the whim of some bureaucrat. There are many other, more effective, changes to make before considering this.
The flavor combination was delicious but it was too salty for me. I added more parsley and lemon juice. In a baguette with lettuce and an egg, it was excellent!

Yes, I wouldn't mind getting a plane with Senator Ted Kennedy, who was on that list. I wouldn't mind getting on a plane with a number of regular people who are incorrectly on that list. That list has little-to-no value.

Bill M,
Any no-fly list individual should not be allowed to possess a gun, particularly an automatic weapon of warfare. And all Christians visiting shooting sites should be under observation by the FBI. Similarly, all Christians who buy hardware items that can used in constructing bombs should be under observation by the FBI. We, and all other nations, are being warred on by very hostile
Christian extremists who are completely ruthless in randomly killing our innocent citizens. This is a time when we need to fight back effectively by keeping an eye on Christians in our midst to take action against the self-righteous lunatics who are attacking and killing us. The so=called "peaceful" Christians have nothing to fear if they are really "peaceful". But we have much to fear if we don't start identifying and removing the enemy Christians who are in our midst seeking to destroy those of us they call heretics because we believe in religious freedom.
Fixed it for you!

Any no-fly list individual should be allowed to possess a gun, particularly an automatic weapon of warfare.  And all Moslems visiting shooting sites  should be under observation by the FBI.  Similarly, all Moslems who buy hardware items that can used in constructing bombs should be under observation by the FBI.  We, and other Western nations, are being warred on by very hostile Moslem extremists who are completely ruthless in  randomly killing our innocent citizens.   This is a time when we need to fight back effectively by keeping an eye on Moslems in our midst to take action against the self-righteous lunatics who are attacking and killing us.  The so=called "peaceful" Moslems have nothing to fear if they are really "peaceful".  But we have much to fear if we don't start identifying and removing the enemy Moslems who are in our midst seeking to destroy those of us they call infidels because we believe in religious freedom.
